JobTitle: Analyst /Senior Analyst, Lifecycle Marketing – US SME ValGen Team - Card Treatments
JobFullDesc:
The Analyst/Sr. Analyst, Lifecycle Marketing, will support an array of offer strategies for Small and Medium Business Card products (mostly focused on Employee Cards, but x-sell and upgrades may be a component) and drive results through customer insights, CCP engagement and motivation (CCPs are the Customer Care Professionals who service our customers over the phone and chat), and flawless end-to-end offer execution.
This is a great opportunity to be involved in a highly visible revenue generating work stream, while partnering closely with the Product team, Legal and Compliance, and our Global Servicing Network partners to ensure that our Card and Non-Card offers are launched successfully and presented to Card Members in the clearest manner possible. The Analyst/Sr. Analyst will also have opportunities to enhance the offer strategy through incentivized offers and special pricing in the channel. 
Key Responsibilities:

Assist Manager/Sr. Manager with the Card dialogic and chat offer st; this includes organizing and attending meetings with GSN, Product, and CRM partners to learn key insights about the Product.
Analyze and compile customer insights and CCP feedback to help drive phone channel strategy
Work closely with Marketing and Product Managers to align campaign timelines and coordinate changes to offers
Support end-to-end marketing campaign set-up and execution by managing offer creative assets, including CCP scripts, and ensuring timely implementation of legal updates and language consistency across offers
Assist Product Management team in maximizing the effectiveness of product launches and other product initiatives in Phoenix and for Home Based CCPs. Includes site visits, blitzes, CCP trainings, drafting of CCP launch announcements and communications. 
Analyze monthly offer results and share reports and drivers with larger team and leadership    


Bachelor’s degree, with an interest in marketing
1 – 3 years of work experience preferred
Self-starter who thrives in a rapidly changing, dynamic environment
Excellent analytic and communication skills
Highly skilled in Excel (understanding how to develop and work with pivot tables, charts, etc.)
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills
Ability to multi-task, operate autonomously, prioritize effectively, and meet aggressive deadlines
Ability to collaborate and influence across teams

 
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.
Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.
